means: 格言，座右铭( maxim的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: Courts also draw freely on traditional maxims of construction.
sentence.Network_cn: 法院也自由吸收传统的解释准则.

sentence.Network_en: There are variant formulations of some of the maxims.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些准则有多种表达方式.

sentence.Network_en: The relationship between Nixon and Agnew illustrated these maxims.
sentence.Network_cn: 尼克松和阿格纽之间的关系就是这些准则的证明.

PerfectNetExp.abs: to be more specific , there are four maxims under this general principle更确切的说，这条基本原则包括四条准则

in order to guarantee the smooth conversational progression , two parties in communication should obey the cooperative principle and its maxims .为了使会话顺利进行，交际双方必须共同遵守“合作原则”及其子准则。
the quintessence of confucianism in the proverbs and maxims ., 谚语格言中的儒家思想精髓.

entry.def: A maxim is a rule for good or sensible behaviour, especially one in the form of a saying.

example.ex: I believe in the maxim 'if it ain't broke, don't fix it'.
example.tran: 我相信这样一条箴言：“不破不修”。

auth_sentence.content: I was soon following several of the great political adviser's key maxims.

auth_sentence.content: These are all the maxims of good health and mental function at any age.
